data.title: The England Women's Football Team 1970
data.text:
These matches are deemed as unofficial Season 1969-70

x

Harry Batt

1969 Coppa Europa per Nazioni (2x35min played)

u/o semi-final 1 November 1969 - Denmark 4 England 3 [3-1]

Stadio Mario Puchoz, Aosta (2,500) ref: Turco (Ita) Christensen (2), Ševčíková, L.Hansen

Lopez (3) NL Sue Tungate missed a penalty kick Denmark: Joan Thomsen, Joan Nielsen, Birgit Nielsen, Jana Mandiková, Kirsten Schäeffer, Inge Kristensen, Maria Ševčíková, Lone Hansen, Irene Christensen, Helene Østergaard Hansen, Solveig Hansen.

England: Sue Beckett, Mary Blake, Jill Long, Barbara Birkett, Tina Oliver, Valerie Cheshire, Paula Rayner, Dot Cassell, Sue Lopezᶜ, Sue Tungate, Gail Gunnell. third-place play-off 2 November 1969 - England 2 France 0 [1-0]

Stadio Comunale, Torino (tbc) Tungate, Lopez NW England: Sue Beckett, Mary Blake, Jill Long, Dot Cassell, Barbara Birkett, Gail Gunnell, Paula Rayner, Tina Oliver, Sue Lopezᶜ, Sue Tungate, Chris Salmon.

France: Dominique Defraiteur, Claude Gilbert, Chantel Lebrun, Régine Porveux, Maud Fabry (Rosine Nizard), Nicole Mangas, Maryse Lesieur, Nelly Rebᶜ , Marie-Claire Harent, Nadine Juillard, Michèle Monier. Manager: Pierre Geoffroy

x

Coppa del Mondo femminile Trofeo Martini & Rossi (2x35min played) u/o group B quarter-final 7 July 1970 - England 5 West Germany 1 [4-0]

Stadi Luigi Ferraris, Genova (3,000) ref: Loffi (Ita) Briggs (2), Stockley (pen), Cross, Dolling

Arzdorf or Schmied NW England: Kath Everitt, Sue Knowles, Valerie Cheshire, [name missing], Jill Stockley, Valerie Reid (June Foulke), Paula Rayner, Angela King, Joan Briggs, 10.Barbara Dolling, Louise Cross.

West Germany: Marie Nelles, Anneliese Probst, Gaby Marino, Helga Waluga, Gaby Wilke (Christa Seeliger), Ruth Rosenberg, Elisebeth Schumacher, Margaretha Hollᶜ, Mrtina Arzdorf, Sieglinde Schmied, Sieglinde Justen. Manager: Heinz Schweden semi-final 10 July 1970 - Denmark 2 England 0 [0-0]

Stadio Arena, Milano (7,000) ref: Francesco Lojacono (Ita) Evers (2) NL Denmark: Jytta Termansen, Birgit Nielsen, Jacobsen, Ann Lindh, Kirsten Schäeffer, Inge Kristensen (Joan Thomsen), Jana Mandiková, Helene Østergaard Hansen, Irene Christensen, Kirsten Evers, Lone Hansen (Maria Ševčíková). Manager: Svend Åge Pedersen.

England: Kath Everitt, Sue Knowles, Valerie Cheshire, June Foulke, Jill Stockley, Valerie Reid (Paula Rayner), Davies, Angela King, Joan Briggs, 10.Barbara Dolling, Louis Cross. third-place play-off 13 July 1970 - Mexico 3 England 2 [3-1]

Stadio Comunale, Torino (3,000) ref: Sicco (Ita) Vargas, Hernández, Tovar

Davies, Stockley (pen) NL Mexico: Yolanda Ramírez, Irma Chávez, Elsa Salgado, Cristina García, María Acela Nila, Guadalupe Tovarᶜ, Alicia Vargas, Elsa Huerta, Patricia Hernández, Maria De la Luz or Martha Coronado (Rebeca Lara Pérez), Maria Eugenia Rubio. Manager: José Morales.

England: Kath Everitt, Sue Knowles, Marion Crook, Valerie Reid (Valerie Cheshire), Jill Stockley, June Foulke, Paula Rayner, Davies, Joan Briggs, 10.Barbara Dolling, Louis Cross.

Seasons 1970-72

x

Frank Baker

Coppa del Mondo femminile Trofeo Martini & Rossi (2x35min played) u/o Qualifying round Group 1 2 June 1971 - Italy 7 England 0 [5-0]

Stadio Provinciale, Erice (10,000)

ref: Francesco Lojacono (Ita) Avon (2), Ciceri (4), Vignotto AL Italy: Derna Isolini, Maria Castelli (Erminia Labarbera or Bonini), Maria Fabris (possibly substituted instead), Paola Cardia, Manuela Pinardi, Elena Schiavoᶜ, Liliana Mammina or Strazza, Manola Conter, Maurizia Ciceri, Claudia Avon, Elisabetta Vignotto. Manager: Giuseppe Cavićchi.

England: Lillian Harris, Valerie Cheshire, Chris Lockwood, Trudy McCaffery, Carol Wilsonᶜ, Jill Stockley (Jean Breckon), Paula Rayner, Leah Caleb, Jan Barton, June Davies, Louise Cross. 4 June 1971 - England 3 Austria 0 [2-0]

Stadio Cibali, Catania (2,000) ref: Giovanni Mosca (Ita) Barton (2), Rayner NW England: Lillian Harris, Carol Wilsonᶜ, Jean Breckon, Trudy McCaffery, Jill Stockley, Valerie Cheshire, Paula Rayner, Leah Caleb, Jan Barton, Chris Lockwood, Louise Cross.

Austria: Gredinget, Hackl, Pinter, Goldschmidt, Zechmann, Zeiset, Iider, Einlambof, Jrosz, Pamminger, Wachtlet. Manager: Helmut Goldschmidt. England are runners-up in Group 1 and should have been eliminated if not for all teams in Group 4 withdrew FINALS group A 21 August 1971 - Argentina 4 England 1 [3-1]

Estadio Azteca, Ciudad Ciudad de México (25,000)

ref: José López Torres (Mex) Selva (4 (1 pen))

Rayner or Barton NL Norberto Rozas²⁶ Jan Barton⁵⁴ Argentina: Marta Soler, Zulma Gómez (Ofelia Feito), Virginia Cataneo, Teresa Suárez, Zunilda Troncoso, Angélica Cardozoᶜ (MarÃ­a Cáceres), Virginia Andrada, Eva Lembesis, Betty García, Elba Selva, Blanca Brúccoli. Manager: EfraÃ­n Pérez Ramérez.

England: Lillian Harris, Jill Stockley, Valerie Cheshire, Jean Breckon, Carol Wilsonᶜ, Trudy McCaffery, Leah Caleb, Louise Cross, Jan Barton, Paula Rayner (Gill Sayell), Chris Lockwood. 22 August 1971 - Mexico 4 England 0 [1-0]

Estadio Azteca, Ciudad Ciudad de México (90,000)

ref: Stèphane Frère (Fra) Rangel, Aguilar (2), Huerta AL Mexico: Elvira Aracén, Lourdes de la Rosa, Bertha Orduña, Marta Coronado, Paula Pérez, Guadalupe Tovarᶜ (MarÃ­a de la Luz), Elsa Huerta, Alicia Vargas, Silvia Zaragoza, Eréndira Rangel (Teresa Aguilar), María Eugenia Rubio. Manager: Norberto Rozas.

England: Lillian Harris, Jill Stockley (Chris Lockwood), Valerie Cheshire, Jean Breckon, Carol Wilsonᶜ , Trudy McCaffery (Marlene Collins), Leah Caleb, Louise Cross, Jan Barton, Paula Rayner, Yvonne Farr. fifth-place play-off 28 August 1971 - France 3 England 2 [3-2]

Estadio Azteca, Ciudad Ciudad de México (25,000)

ref: Grecia del Ángel (Mex) Binard, Henry, Tschopp or Royer

Barton, Cross or Barton NL France: Marie-Louise Butzig, Chantal Serre, Colette Guyard, Nicole Mangas, Marie-Bernadette Thomas, Betty Goret, Armelle Binard, Jocelyne Ratignier, Jocelyne Henry (Ghislaine Royer), Marie-Christine Tschoppᶜ, Claudine Dié. Manager: Pierre Geoffroy.

England: Lillian Harris, Valerie Cheshire, Elsa Salgado*, Teresa Viguera* (Chris Lockwood), Marlene Collins, Jean Breckon, Cecilia Gallegos*, Gill Sayell, Paula Rayner, Jan Barton, Louise Cross.

Because of injuries, England were permitted to play with three Mexicans*. Season 1972-73

x

Harry Batt

Friendly match u/o 5 August 1972 - Italy 2 England (Harry Batt XI) 0 [2-0]

Livorno (tbc) Ref: Cosentina (Italy) Stopar, Goso AL Italy: Landi, Giovannini, Stopar, Cunzolo, Amico, Corrini, Cherillo, Moiraghi, Goso, Mucci, Pistoni, Manager: Olivieiri.

England: Bobbie Wing (Hoodles), Bird, Langey, Parson (Faulkner), Elliot, Nichols, Hutchinson, Graffer, Paula Rayner, Cecilia Gallegos, Daly

Season 1973-74

x

Tommy Tranter (manager of Southall FC)

4 7 September 1973 - England 5 Northern Ireland 1 [nk]

Twerton Park, Bath (tbc) Ref: P.Davies Allott, Hale (2), Dunlop OG, Gore

Gillespie HW England: Sue Buckett, Margaret Miks, Morag Kirkland, Wendy Owen, Sheila Parkerᶜ, Janet Bagguley, Lynda Hale, Sue Lopez, Pat Firth, Eileen Foreman, Jeannie Allott. (substitutes: Paddy McGroarty, Julia Manning, Sylvia Gore, Susan Whyatt, Pat Davies, Lesley Stirling).

Northern Ireland: Hilary Brady, Elizabeth Gadsby, Margaret Dunlop, Madeleine Wright, Jennifer Whiteside, Doreen Little, Alison Brennington, Stephanie McNally, Louise Fleming, Sharon Gillespie, Hazel McQuiston. (substitutes: Kathleen Moore, Liz McNamara, Allayan McNeil). Manager: Carson Reid

5 9 November 1973 - England 1 Netherlands 0 [1-0]

Elm Park, Reading (2,015) Ref: Keith Walker McGroarty HW England: Sue Buckett, Margaret Miks, Janet Bagguley, Sheila Parkerᶜ, Wendy Owen, Sue Lopez, Lynda Hale, Paddy McGroarty, Eileen Foreman, Pat Firth, Jeannie Allott. (used substitute: Julia Manning, other substitutes not known).

Netherlands: Hanny van de Bungelaar (Hennie van Rooyen-Vernooij), Hennie Schlimbach-Smit, Ellen Popeyus, Marian Wellenberg, Truus Deen (Tiny de Kort), Conny de Jong-Welgraven, Jos Andewag-de Vroedt, Jo Fuchs, José van Hoof, Tilly Asdonck-van Rooijen, Wilma van Elderen (Hanneke van der Veen). (unused: Siny van Sluijters, E.van de Seys). Manager: Bert Wouterse -

This is Netherland's first fixture for the women's side.

6 17 March 1974 - England 5 Wales 0 [nk-0]

Wexham Park, Slough (500) Ref: D.Haywood McGroarty (2), Davies, Firth, Manning HW England: Sue Buckett, Margaret Miks, Morag Kirkland, Wendy Owen, Sheila Parkerᶜ, Janet Bagguley, Paddy McGroarty, Sue Lopez, Pat Firth, Lynda Hale, Pat Davies (substitute: Julia Manning; unused: Lesley Stirling, Jeannie Allott).

Wales: Sheryl Evans, Gaynor Jones, Valerie Bevan, Michele Adams, Tina Cositori, Mai Griffith, Diane Totty, Julie Yale, Karen Wells, Brenda Jones, Ann Rice. (substitutes: Pat Griffith, Gloria O'Connor, Pauline Parker, Linda James). Manager: Dave Powell

7 31 May 1974 - Netherlands 0 England 3 [0-2]

Stadspark, Groningen (3,000) Ref: Frans Derks Lopez, Davies (2) AW Netherlands: Hanny van de Bungelaar (Hennie van Rooyen-Vernooij), Jos Andewag-de Vroedt (Hanneke van der Veen), Tilly Asdonck-van Rooijen, Tiny Baay (Anja ter Horst), José van Hoof, Conny de Jong-Welgraven, Tiny de Kort, Ellen Popeyus, Hennie Schlimbach-Smit, Bep Timmer, Marian Wellenberg. (unused: Wilma van Elderen). Manager: Bert Wouterse

England: Sue Buckett, Margaret Miks, (numbers 3-8 not known), Sue Lopez, Pat Davies, Jeannie Allott (used substitute; Julia Brunton (née Manning) substitutes not known).

Season 1975-76

11 7 September 1975 - England 1 Sweden 3 [1-1]

Plough Lane, Wimbledon (tbc) Ref: Bartley John Homewood Deighan

Sundhage, Håkansson (2) HL England: Sue Buckett, Alison Leatherbarrow (Carol McCune), Morag Kirkland, Wendy Owen, Sheila Parkerᶜ, Raynor Hadden, Sandra Choat, Lorraine Dobb (Angela Smith), Elaine Badrock, Liz Deighan, Jeannie Allott. (unused not known).

Sweden: Sabrine Piltorp, Lena Bergman Isberg, Anette Börjesson, Christina Norin (Ingalil Arvling), Mary Olsson, Görel Sintorn, Aulikki Suomela, Lona Svensson (Ula Håkansson), Ann Jansson, Pia Sundhage, Anne Andersen (Lilbeth Svärd). (unused: Gun Engfors, Ann Magnusson). Manager: Hasse Karlsson

12 2 May 1976 - England 2 Netherlands 1 [2-1]

2x35min played

Borough Park, Blackpool (4,000) Ref: K.Walmsley Badrock, Choat (pen)

de Visser HW England: Sue Buckett, Carol McCune, Morag Kirkland, Alison Leatherbarrow, Sheila Parkerᶜ, Sue Lopez, Sandra Choat, Lorraine Dobb, Elaine Badrock, Liz Deighan, Jeannie Allott. (substitutes: Janet Bagguley, Wendy Owen, Pauline Chilton, Raynor Hadden).

Netherlands: Hanny van de Bungelaar, Tilly Asdonck-van Rooijen (Loltje van de Mossel), Jos Andewag-de Vroedtᶜ, José van Hoof (Sylvia Genderen), Conny de Jong-Welgraven, Aukje Kuipers (Chista Nannings), Ellen Popeyus, Bep Timmer, Wil de Visser, Ria van Hassel, Hennie Schlimbach-Smit.(unused: Hennie va Rooyen-Vernooij, Astrid Molenaar). Manager: George K. Norel The Pony Home International Championship

13

22 May 1976 - England 4 Wales 0 [nk-0]

The Eyrie, Bedford (tbc) Ref: John Hunting Firth, Badrock (2), Poppy HW England: Sue Buckett, Carol McCuneᶜ, Morag Kirkland, Alison Leatherbarrow, Wendy Owen, Linda Coffin, Lorraine Dobb, Raynor Hadden, Elaine Badrock, Pat Firth, Pat Chapman. (substitutes: Kathy Hamstead, Debbie Smith, Angela Poppy, Audrey Rigby).

Wales: Dianne Totty, Gillian Maskell, Karen Wells, Ann Jenkins, Jayne Angrove, Debbie Pearson, Julie Yale, Linda James, Shelley Walters, Gloria O'Connell, Mai Griffith. (substitutes: Gillian Rowlands, Lesley Judd, Sally Manley, June Houldey). Manager: unknown

Stadio Flaminio, Roma (tbc) Ref: Barra Vignotto (2) AL Italy: Wilma Seghetti, Rocca (Silvia Silvaggi), Maura Furlotti, Manola Conter, Coda, Bandini, Elena Schiavo, Sacchi (Greco), Betty Vignotto, Gualdi, Liliana Mammina (Maurizia Cien). (unused not known). Manager: Amedeo Amadei

Stadio La Fiorita, Cesena (1,500) Ref: Beretta Ciceri, Ferraguzzi

Badrock or Coffin AL Italy: Wilma Seghetti, Rocca, Maura Furlotti, Gerolama Greco, Coda, Stefania Bandini, Elena Schiavo, Sacchi (Fery Ferraguzzi), Betty Vignotto, Gualdi, Maurizia Ciceri (Antonietta Cherillo). (unused not known). Manager: Amedeo Amadei

Season 1976-77

17 17 October 1976 - Wales 1 England 2 [nk]

Eugene Cross Welfare Ground, Ebbw Vale (tbc) Ref: tbc not known

Hadden, Badrock AW Wales: team not known. Manager not known

England: team not known. According to the first edition of 'Women's Football', the official magazine of the Women's Football Association, at the beginning of the 1977-78 season, this game was won 3-2 by England.

18 26 February 1977 - France 0 England 0 [0-0] 2x35min played

Longjumeau (1,200) Ref: Jean Muchembled AD France: Danielle Vatin, Patricia Mousel, Marie-Noëlle Fourdrignier Warot, Annie Bataille, Maria-Bernadette Thomas, Elisabeth Dejean, Michèle Wolf, Renée Delahaye (Marie-Laure Montauroil), Véronique Roy (Martine Thivolle), Christine Scharo (Armelle Binard), Marlène Farrugia. (unused not known). Manager: Francis-Pierre Coche

England: team not known.

19 28 April 1977 - England 9 Switzerland 1 [7-1]

Boothferry Park, Hull (2,800) Ref: Reg Matthewson Foreman (2), Chapman (3), Deighan, Parker (2), Coffin

Boll HW England: Sue Buckett, Carol McCuneᶜ, Alison Leatherbarrow, Linda Curl (Sheila Parker), Linda Coffin, Lorraine Dobb, Christine Hutchinson, Liz Deighan, Eileen Foreman, Sue Lopez, Pat Chapman. (unused: Lynda Hale, Josie Lee, Morag Kirkland, Janet Milner).

Switzerland: Mirella Cina (E.Huber), Nadja Ripamoni, Antionette Bayer, Jeanette Thomet, E.Näpflin (Morena Pestoni), M.Kaufmann, Madeleine Boll, I.Grim, Fiorenza Kretz (S.Kuttruff), C.Hüsler (Jeanette Fontanive), Helena Barmettler. (unused not known). Manager: Libero Taddei

20 29 May 1977 - Scotland 2 England 1 [1-0]

Downfield Park, Dundee (1,000) Ref: J. Morrison Creamer, Blagojević

Lopez (pen) AL Scotland: Elizabeth Smith, Marian Barclay, Margaret McAuley, A.Squires, Sheila Begbie, Elizabeth Vinesky (Betty Ure), Jane Legget, Mary O'Neil, Elizabeth Creamer (Marie Blagojević), A.Reilly, Lorraine Spurvey. (unused not known). Manager: unknown

England: Janet Milner, Carol McCuneᶜ, Alison Leatherbarrow, Josie Lee, Linda Coffin, Lorraine Dobb, Linda Curl, Liz Deighan (Sue Lopez), Eileen Foreman, Christine Hutchinson, Pat Chapman. (unused: Sheila Parker, Sue Buckett).

Season 1977-78 Queen's Silver Jubilee International

21 18 September 1977 - England 5 Wales 0 [0-0]

Weymouth Street, Warminster (1,600) Ref: tbc Parker, Lopez (pen), Badrock, Day, Foreman HW England: team not known.

Wales: team not known. Manager not known The following weekend was planned for England coaching sessions. Friendly matches

22 15 November 1977 - England 1 Italy 0 [1-0]

2x40min played

Plough Lane, Wimbledon (tbc) Ref: Reynolds Parker HW England: Sue Buckett, Carol McCuneᶜ, Alison Leatherbarrow, Lorraine Dobb, Linda Coffin, Linda Curl, Sheila Parker, Sue Lopez, Eileen Foreman, Debbie Day, Pat Chapman. (substitutes not known).

Italy: Wilma Seghetti, Maria Sosella, Maura Furlotti, Stefania Bandini, Rita Pedrali, Fery Ferraguzzi, Gerolama Greco, Novellina Babetto, Luciana Meles (Gualdi), Betty Vignotto, Liliana Mammina (Antonietta Cherillo). (unused not known). Manager: Amedeo Amadei England were presented with a trophy from Martini and Rossi Limited by Sir Fred Pontin.

23 2 May 1978 - England 6 Republic of Ireland 1 [nk]

St. James' Park, Exeter (tbc) Ref: tbc Lopez (2), Foreman (2), Day, Dobb (pen)Hynes (pen) HW England: team not known.

Republic of Ireland: team not known. Manager not known

Season 1978-79

24 30 September 1978 - Netherlands 3 England 1 [1-0]

Sportpark Irislaan, Vlissingen (1,000) Ref: GHH van der Linden Van Hoof (2), Manuputty

Chapman AL Netherlands: Sjoukje Leistra, Jos Andewag-de Vroedtᶜ (Wil de Visser), Margaret van Dinten, José van Hoof, Elly Manuputty (Tonnie Meijerink-van de Boom), Chista Nannings, Ellen Popeyus, Edith Ramakers, El Schoon, Wil Siereveld, Bep Timmer. (unused: Hennie va Rooyen-Vernooij, Aukje Kuipers). Manager: Ruud de Groot

25 31 October 1978 - England 3 Belgium 0 [1-0]

The Dell, Southampton (5,471) Ref: Clive White Badrock (2), Curl HW England: Sue Buckett, Carol McCuneᶜ, Morag Pearce, Lorraine Dobb, Linda Coffin, Linda Curl, ?, Sheila Parker, Sue Lopez, Elaine Badrock, Pat Chapman. (also in squad: Liz Deighan, Alison Leatherbarrow, Debbie Brampton, Julie Brown, Pat Napier).

Belgium: Daniella Ottoy, Agnès Debock, Lutgart Diercks, Gerda Colpaert, Maria Seymus, Conny Dubois, Annie-Marie Carrette, Monique Huybrechts, Sandra Temmerman, Marina Cerdonck, Jeanine Van Buel. (substitutes not known). Manager: A.Bers 'Women's Football' stated that England's second goal was an own goal by Carrette, rather than being Linda Curl's goal.

Stadion Hvidovre, København (480) Ref: Jørgen Mortensen Barsballe, Holst, Larsen

Scafati (tbc)

3-4 on penalty-kicks ND Penalty shoot-out:- England's scorers were Wiseman, Curl and Lopez. Sweden's were Borjesson, Ottosson, Lindqvist and Åhman. (other sub used: Ing-Marie Ottosson, unused: Elisabeth Leidinge). Manager: Ulf Bergquist Extra time was of twenty minutes' duration.

England 7 Northern Ireland 1 [2-0]

Gresty Road, Crewe (tbc) Ref: tbc Davis (2), Doe, Curl (2 (1 pen)), Turner, Coultard
